wp:term.wp:term_description: On Lake Michigan in Illinois, is among the largest cities in the U.S. Famed for its bold architecture, it has a skyline punctuated by skyscrapers such as the iconic John Hancock Center. Willis Tower (formerly the Sears Tower) and the neo-Gothic Tribune Tower. The city is also renowned for its museums, including the Art Institute of Chicago with its noted Impressionist and Post-Impressionist works.

Los Angeles is a sprawling Southern California city and the center of the nation’s film and television industry. Near its iconic Hollywood sign, studios such as Paramount Pictures, Universal and Warner Brothers offer behind-the-scenes tours.

Miami is the cultural, economic and financial center of South Florida in the United States. The city covers an area of about 56 square miles between the Everglades to the west and Biscayne Bay to the east.

New York City comprises 5 boroughs sitting where the Hudson River meets the Atlantic Ocean. At its core is Manhattan, a densely populated borough that’s among the world’s major commercial, financial and cultural centers. Its iconic sites include skyscrapers such as the Empire State Building and sprawling Central Park.

Orlando, a city in central Florida, is home to more than a dozen theme parks. Chief among its claims to fame is Walt Disney World, comprised of parks like the Magic Kingdom and Epcot, as well as water parks.

San Francisco, is the cultural, commercial, and financial center of Northern California. San Francisco is known for its cool summers, fog, steep rolling hills, eclectic mix of architecture, and landmarks, including the Golden Gate Bridge, cable cars, the former Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary, Fisherman's Wharf, and its Chinatown district.

item.title: Alice Estate Agency
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Alice is a broker associate and Realtor. She is dedicated in helping buyers and sellers throughout the city. She enjoys the local aspect of real estate, spending time discovering and sharing the city community with her clients, including parks, neighbourhoods, changing trends and resources like restaurants and music venues.
She has served as her building’s board president for the past two years. She is also active in the community as a volunteer and donor for Children’s Services. Her designations include Certified International Property Specialist and membership of the International Real Estate Federation. Clients are impressed by her tireless work, negotiation skills, and business sense. They appreciate her communication skills, knowledge and ability to help them meet their real estate goals.

item.title: Custom Property Detail Page
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Featured

A Grand Modern Apartment

$149 Per Night

Chicago, Illinois, United States of America

4 Photos Featured

A Grand Modern Apartment

$149 Per Night

Chicago, Illinois, United States of America

Overview

| Property ID : RH-5092-property Beds 2 Baths 2 Guests 6 Min Stay 1 Parking 2 Year Built 2020 Area 2630 sq ft

Price Details

  • Cleaning Fee :(per night per guest)$5
  • Security :(per stay)2%
  • Extra Guest Price :(per night)$50
  • Service Charges:(per stay)5%
  • Govt Tax :(per stay)7%
  • Bulk Prices
  • Price per night (3days+) :$142
  • Price per night (7days+) :$135

Seasonal Prices

Start Date End Date Per Night
2021-10-15 2021-10-20 $169
2021-12-10 2021-12-14 $130

Description

Here's an unbeatable opportunity to get into the market at a sparkling clean price. Set on a private, southwest corner of a well managed complex in the heart of vibrant central Kamloops, this home has been designed to take advantage of its beach frontage with decks running the entire length of the house and out over the boathouse. Immaculate south facing 2 great bedroom, 2 bathroom corner suite in the community of Dollarton Harbour. Beautiful Gibraltar Model enhanced by 36'x 17' Screened Patio with beautiful travertine floor adding natural richness & a unique appearance to the patio. Perfect for an investor (short term rental rates are close to $2,000 per month) or for a first time home buyer (furniture negotiable!). Located in-town, adjacent to Happy Valley, for an eco-friendly walk everywhere lifestyle. This easy care property features a west facing patio off the kitchen ideal for summer BBQs and entertaining. It's tastefully updated – vaulted ceilings showcasing the log construction, hard surface counter-tops, commercial grade Wolf & Sub Zero appliances, hardwood & tile floors & security system sound and vac roughed in.

Guests Accommodation

  • Master Room: 1 King Bed (2 guests)
  • Bedroom 1: 1 Queen Bed (2 guests)
  • Living Room: 1 Sofa Bed (1 guests)

Amenities

  • Air Conditioning
  • Cable TV
  • Coffee Maker
  • Dryer
  • Elevator
  • Free Parking
  • Heating
  • Hot Water
  • Iron
  • Kitchen
  • Laptop Friendly
  • Microwave
  • Refrigerator
  • Wifi

Surroundings

  • Water Park
    5 Minutes Drive
  • Grocery Store
    2 Minutes Drive
  • Downtown
    10 Minutes Drive
  • Theme Park
    15 Minutes Drive
  • Airport
    18 Minutes Drive

Outdoor Features

  • Balcony
  • Sun Loungers
  • Natural Gas Barbecue
  • Hot Tub
  • Heat Lamp

Services

Included
  • Housekeeping
  • Apartment Pre-Stocking
Not Included
  • Airport Transfer

Property Rules

  • Check-in: 2:00 PM - 12:00 AM
  • Checkout: 12:00 PM
  • No Smoking
  • No Pets
  • No Parties or Events
  • Minimum age of primary renter: 18
  • 100% refund if canceled at least 30 days before arrival date. 50% refund if canceled at least 7 days before arrival date.

item.title: What if I accidentally cause damage to the property?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Don’t worry – accidents happen. Tell whoever is responsible for the property maintenance as soon as possible. You will be expected to cover the cost of putting it right.

Don’t try to ignore or hide damage because it could get worse, and it will only come out of your deposit at the end of the tenancy.

item.title: What’s the pet policy?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
The pet policy depends on the terms in each specific lease agreement. You must notify our team of any pets before move-in.

When you already have a pet and you want to add an extra one, please call our office first. We will process every request separately depending on the lease terms.

item.title: Can I decorate or make changes to the property?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: In most cases, a tenant can only decorate or make changes to the property with the express permission of the landlord. We recommend receiving this permission in writing.

item.title: Can I change the locks?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: No, installing new locks on your own would violate the lease agreement terms. It's possible to install a new lock upon request and approval; this may be a tenant charge depending on the situation.

item.title: What happens if I can’t pay the rent on time?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: Any problems that may affect the potential payment of rent should be notified to the relevant office straight away. You may be charged a fee for late payment of rent.

item.title: When do you increase the rent?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Rent increases usually happen after the lease term expiration.

Of course, it isn't always increased. Our analysis accounts for the property owner's requests and relevant market conditions.

item.title: Do I need renters insurance?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Yes, all the tenants need to have renters insurance before moving in.

You have to show a renters’ insurance confirmation before getting the keys.

item.title: What is your security deposit policy?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: Security deposit equals to one month rent and may vary based on credit. You need to pay the full amount before moving in.

item.title: How can I visit a property?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Call the number on the listing directly or request the booking through view booking form.

After receiving a request, we'll quickly organize a property viewing. Our goal is to make sure you'll find your dream home.

Please note that we are required to provide current tenants at occupied properties at least 24 hours’ notice prior to scheduled showings.

item.title: Is it possible to apply for a property that I haven’t viewed?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
We prefer for all applicants to either see the property in person or send a trusted 3rd party to view on their behalf.

We understand that you may not have time to view the property. In this case, you could arrange for a friend or family member to view the property on your behalf.

It's important to see the property instead of only looking at the photos. The photos serve as an approximate representation. Applicants should check whether the property matches their expectations and needs.

item.title: What is a vacation rental?
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Vacation rentals are freestanding, attached or guest houses, villas, cottages, apartments, condos, and timeshares offered for short term occupancy.

They are largely unregulated. Some rental properties are just one in a large portfolio handled and managed by a leasing company. Other vacation rentals are cared for and rented out by, the owner.

item.title: Become A Host
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Easily host your place and earn with RealHomes

Hosting a place has never been easier. You’re just a few steps away from earning money and reaching many travelers.

Become a host

RealHomes has allowed me to create my own job by hosting my place and earning rental income - Charlotte

How does hosting your place works?

List Your Place

Share the unique charm of your property by creating a detailed listing. Showcase your space with photos and descriptions to attract potential renters.

Host Travellers

Welcome guests into your home by setting clear house rules and guidelines. Make their stay memorable with excellent communication and local insights.

Earn Rental Income

Maximize your earnings as a host. Accept bookings, maintain your property, and provide exceptional hospitality. Transform your space into a lucrative source of rental income.

RealHomes provides the right experience for you

Manage Bookings

Streamline your rental experience with our easy-to-use booking management system. Take control of your reservations effortlessly.

Low Fees

Enjoy cost-effective rental solutions. We offer competitive fees, ensuring you maximize your earnings as a host.

Multiple Properties

List and manage multiple properties hassle-free. Expand your rental portfolio with ease on our platform.

Amazing Support Team

Our dedicated support team is here for you. Count on us for quick and reliable assistance, 24/7.

Efficient Approvals

Experience swift and efficient approval processes. Get your rental applications processed promptly, saving you time.

Highly Customizable

Tailor your listings to your liking. Our platform offers extensive customization options for your rental properties.

Check what our amazing hosts have to say!

Frequently Asked Questions!

Do you have a question? Explore our comprehensive FAQs for quick solutions. If you don't find what you need, our support team is just a message away!

Get Started
How do I get started as a host?

To embark on your journey as a host, begin by signing up on our platform. Once registered, you can create a listing for your property. Be sure to provide comprehensive details, including photos, descriptions, and any unique features that make your property stand out.

What kind of properties can I list?

You have the flexibility to list a wide range of properties, from cozy apartments and spacious houses to unique and exotic spaces like treehouses, houseboats, or cabins in the woods. It’s all about sharing what makes your space special with travelers.

Are there any requirements to become a host?

While the specific requirements may vary by location, generally, you’ll need a property that you’re legally authorized to host. This might include owning the property or obtaining permission from the property owner. Additionally, a commitment to creating a safe and welcoming environment for guests is essential.

How do I set the rental price for my property?

Determining the right rental price is crucial. Factors like your property’s location, type, size, amenities, and local demand influence pricing decisions. You can also use our platform’s pricing tools and research similar listings for guidance.

Do I need to be present during my guests' stay?

Not necessarily. As a host, you have the flexibility to choose your level of involvement. Some hosts prefer to meet guests personally and offer guidance, while others provide guests with complete privacy using self-check-in methods.

How do I ensure the safety of my property and guests?

Safety is paramount. Implement thorough guest vetting, establish clear house rules, and maintain open communication with guests. Additionally, consider security measures like locks, smoke detectors, and providing emergency contact information to ensure a safe and secure stay.

What support and resources are available for hosts?

Our platform is designed to support hosts at every step. You’ll find resources, tools, and guides to help you manage your listings efficiently. Plus, you can connect with our host community to share experiences, gain insights, and access valuable advice on becoming a successful host.

Started","background_color":"#1C61E7","icon_indent":{"unit":"px","size":0,"sizes":[]},"typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_size":{"unit":"px","size":16,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_weight":"500","_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"2","right":"0","bottom":"2","left":"0","isLinked":false},"link":{"url":"https://di.realhomes.io/vacation-rentals-ultra/dashboard-2/?module=properties&submodule=submit-property","is_external":"","nofollow":"","custom_attributes":""},"button_background_hover_color":"#FFFFFF","__globals__":{"background_color":"","button_hover_border_color":"","button_background_hover_color":"","hover_color":""},"border_border":"solid","border_width":{"unit":"px","top":"2","right":"2","bottom":"2","left":"2","isLinked":true},"border_radius":{"unit":"px","top":"5","right":"5","bottom":"5","left":"5","isLinked":true},"hover_color":"#1C61E7","button_hover_border_color":"#1C61E7","_css_classes":"ask-for-login"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"button"}],"isInner":false},{"id":"7c965884","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":68.391000000000005,"_inline_size_tablet":100,"padding":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"30","isLinked":false},"padding_tablet":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":true}},"elements":[{"id":"63810b42","elType":"widget","settings":{"tabs":[{"tab_title":"How do I get started as a host?","tab_content":"

To embark on your journey as a host, begin by signing up on our platform. Once registered, you can create a listing for your property. Be sure to provide comprehensive details, including photos, descriptions, and any unique features that make your property stand out.

","_id":"77cb9a1"},{"tab_title":"What kind of properties can I list?","tab_content":"

You have the flexibility to list a wide range of properties, from cozy apartments and spacious houses to unique and exotic spaces like treehouses, houseboats, or cabins in the woods. It's all about sharing what makes your space special with travelers.

","_id":"a2fe204"},{"tab_title":"Are there any requirements to become a host?","tab_content":"

While the specific requirements may vary by location, generally, you'll need a property that you're legally authorized to host. This might include owning the property or obtaining permission from the property owner. Additionally, a commitment to creating a safe and welcoming environment for guests is essential.

","_id":"8a21684"},{"tab_title":"How do I set the rental price for my property?","tab_content":"

Determining the right rental price is crucial. Factors like your property's location, type, size, amenities, and local demand influence pricing decisions. You can also use our platform's pricing tools and research similar listings for guidance.

","_id":"a494c32"},{"tab_title":"Do I need to be present during my guests' stay?","tab_content":"

Not necessarily. As a host, you have the flexibility to choose your level of involvement. Some hosts prefer to meet guests personally and offer guidance, while others provide guests with complete privacy using self-check-in methods.

","_id":"75ded3c"},{"tab_title":"How do I ensure the safety of my property and guests?","tab_content":"

Safety is paramount. Implement thorough guest vetting, establish clear house rules, and maintain open communication with guests. Additionally, consider security measures like locks, smoke detectors, and providing emergency contact information to ensure a safe and secure stay.

","_id":"1075b5e"},{"tab_title":"What support and resources are available for hosts?","tab_content":"

Our platform is designed to support hosts at every step. You'll find resources, tools, and guides to help you manage your listings efficiently. Plus, you can connect with our host community to share experiences, gain insights, and access valuable advice on becoming a successful host.

","_id":"93a04ad"}],"title_typography_font_size_mobile":{"unit":"px","size":18,"sizes":[]},"__globals__":{"icon_color":"","icon_active_color":""},"icon_align":"swap","icon_color":"#1C61E7","icon_active_color":"#2A2A2A"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"inspiry-accordion-widget"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

Hosts Commendations

About their experience with us

Perfectly Tailored Apartments

As a busy IT Consultant, I needed a rental service that understood my needs. RealHomes went above and beyond to find me a modern and convenient apartment that perfectly suits my lifestyle. Their attention to detail and commitment to customer satisfaction are truly commendable.

John Smith IT Consultant

RealHomes: A Stress-Free Search

I can't say enough about the fantastic rental services provided by RealHomes. They made finding my dream apartment a breeze. From their extensive listings to their helpful and friendly staff, the entire process was smooth and stress-free.

Sarah Turner Marketing Manager

Family-Friendly Rentals

I had the pleasure of working with RealHomes to find a comfortable and safe rental property for my family. Their dedicated team listened to our requirements and provided us with several great options. Thanks to them, we now have a wonderful home that meets all our needs.

Maria Rodriguez Nurse at Marry Well Hospital

Your Business's Ideal Space

I was impressed with the professionalism and expertise of RealHomes. They helped me find a commercial space for my small business that exceeded my expectations. The process was efficient, and they negotiated a great lease for me. I highly recommend their services to any business owner.

Michael Johnson Small Business Owner

Simplifying Student Life

RealHomes made my transition to college life so much easier. They found me a safe and affordable apartment close to campus, saving me time and stress. Their friendly team answered all my questions and guided me through the rental process. I'm grateful for their excellent service.

Emily Davis Student ,

item.title: Become a Host
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Easily host your place and earn with RealHomes

Hosting a place has never been easier. You’re just a few steps away from earning money and reaching many travelers.

Become a host

RealHomes has allowed me to create my own job by hosting my place and earning rental income - Charlotte

How does hosting your place works?

List Your Place

Share the unique charm of your property by creating a detailed listing. Showcase your space with photos and descriptions to attract potential renters.

Host Travellers

Welcome guests into your home by setting clear house rules and guidelines. Make their stay memorable with excellent communication and local insights.

Earn Rental Income

Maximize your earnings as a host. Accept bookings, maintain your property, and provide exceptional hospitality. Transform your space into a lucrative source of rental income.

RealHomes provides the right experience for you

Manage Bookings

Streamline your rental experience with our easy-to-use booking management system. Take control of your reservations effortlessly.

Low Fees

Enjoy cost-effective rental solutions. We offer competitive fees, ensuring you maximize your earnings as a host.

Multiple Properties

List and manage multiple properties hassle-free. Expand your rental portfolio with ease on our platform.

Amazing Support Team

Our dedicated support team is here for you. Count on us for quick and reliable assistance, 24/7.

Efficient Approvals

Experience swift and efficient approval processes. Get your rental applications processed promptly, saving you time.

Highly Customizable

Tailor your listings to your liking. Our platform offers extensive customization options for your rental properties.

Check what our amazing hosts have to say!

Discover the experiences of our valued hosts. Read what they have to say about their journey with us in their own words.

  • Being a host with RealHomes Vacation Rental has been an incredible experience. Their platform makes it so easy to list and manage my properties. The support team is top-notch, always there to assist. Thanks to RealHomes Vacation Rental, I've been able to maximize my rental income and provide guests with a fantastic stay.

    Michael William

    Host

  • I've been hosting with RealHomes Vacation Rental for several years now, and it's been nothing short of fantastic. Their low fees and efficient approval process are a game-changer. Plus, their highly customizable platform lets me showcase my properties just the way I want. It's a win-win for hosts and guests alike!

    Olivia Joseph

    Host

RealHomes brings
an amazing experience
for you!

Get Started

12,539

Hosted Places

23030

Visitors Connected

$856K

Earned by Hosts

10K+

Amazing Reviews

Frequently Asked Questions!

Do you have a question? Explore our comprehensive FAQs for quick solutions. If you don't find what you need, our support team is just a message away!

Let's Connect
How do I get started as a host?

To embark on your journey as a host, begin by signing up on our platform. Once registered, you can create a listing for your property. Be sure to provide comprehensive details, including photos, descriptions, and any unique features that make your property stand out.

What kind of properties can I list?

You have the flexibility to list a wide range of properties, from cozy apartments and spacious houses to unique and exotic spaces like treehouses, houseboats, or cabins in the woods. It’s all about sharing what makes your space special with travelers.

Are there any requirements to become a host?

While the specific requirements may vary by location, generally, you’ll need a property that you’re legally authorized to host. This might include owning the property or obtaining permission from the property owner. Additionally, a commitment to creating a safe and welcoming environment for guests is essential.

How do I set the rental price for my property?

Determining the right rental price is crucial. Factors like your property’s location, type, size, amenities, and local demand influence pricing decisions. You can also use our platform’s pricing tools and research similar listings for guidance.

Do I need to be present during my guests' stay?

Not necessarily. As a host, you have the flexibility to choose your level of involvement. Some hosts prefer to meet guests personally and offer guidance, while others provide guests with complete privacy using self-check-in methods.

How do I ensure the safety of my property and guests?

Safety is paramount. Implement thorough guest vetting, establish clear house rules, and maintain open communication with guests. Additionally, consider security measures like locks, smoke detectors, and providing emergency contact information to ensure a safe and secure stay.

What support and resources are available for hosts?

Our platform is designed to support hosts at every step. You’ll find resources, tools, and guides to help you manage your listings efficiently. Plus, you can connect with our host community to share experiences, gain insights, and access valuable advice on becoming a successful host.

do I get started as a host?","tab_content":"

To embark on your journey as a host, begin by signing up on our platform. Once registered, you can create a listing for your property. Be sure to provide comprehensive details, including photos, descriptions, and any unique features that make your property stand out.

","_id":"77cb9a1"},{"tab_title":"What kind of properties can I list?","tab_content":"

You have the flexibility to list a wide range of properties, from cozy apartments and spacious houses to unique and exotic spaces like treehouses, houseboats, or cabins in the woods. It's all about sharing what makes your space special with travelers.

","_id":"a2fe204"},{"tab_title":"Are there any requirements to become a host?","tab_content":"

While the specific requirements may vary by location, generally, you'll need a property that you're legally authorized to host. This might include owning the property or obtaining permission from the property owner. Additionally, a commitment to creating a safe and welcoming environment for guests is essential.

","_id":"8a21684"},{"tab_title":"How do I set the rental price for my property?","tab_content":"

Determining the right rental price is crucial. Factors like your property's location, type, size, amenities, and local demand influence pricing decisions. You can also use our platform's pricing tools and research similar listings for guidance.

","_id":"a494c32"},{"tab_title":"Do I need to be present during my guests' stay?","tab_content":"

Not necessarily. As a host, you have the flexibility to choose your level of involvement. Some hosts prefer to meet guests personally and offer guidance, while others provide guests with complete privacy using self-check-in methods.

","_id":"75ded3c"},{"tab_title":"How do I ensure the safety of my property and guests?","tab_content":"

Safety is paramount. Implement thorough guest vetting, establish clear house rules, and maintain open communication with guests. Additionally, consider security measures like locks, smoke detectors, and providing emergency contact information to ensure a safe and secure stay.

","_id":"1075b5e"},{"tab_title":"What support and resources are available for hosts?","tab_content":"

Our platform is designed to support hosts at every step. You'll find resources, tools, and guides to help you manage your listings efficiently. Plus, you can connect with our host community to share experiences, gain insights, and access valuable advice on becoming a successful host.

","_id":"93a04ad"}],"title_typography_font_size_mobile":{"unit":"px","size":18,"sizes":[]},"__globals__":{"icon_color":"","icon_active_color":""},"icon_align":"swap","icon_color":"#1C61E7","icon_active_color":"#2A2A2A"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"inspiry-accordion-widget"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: When you need to have a utilities-included apartments
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
"Utilities-included apartments" refer to rental units where the cost of utilities like water, electricity, gas, and sometimes even internet and cable TV is bundled into the rent. These types of apartments can be appealing for various reasons, and there are specific situations where they make sense. In this article, we'll explore when you might consider renting a utilities-included apartment.

  1. Budgeting Simplicity: One of the primary reasons people opt for utilities-included apartments is the simplicity it offers in budgeting. With all essential utilities rolled into a single monthly payment, tenants have a clear understanding of their total housing costs, making it easier to manage finances.
  2. Predictable Expenses: Utilities-included apartments provide predictable monthly expenses, which can be especially beneficial for those on fixed incomes or tight budgets. It eliminates the unpredictability of utility bills, which can vary significantly with changes in weather or usage.
  3. Short-Term Stays: If you're planning to stay in an area for a short period, such as a few months or a year, utilities-included apartments can be a convenient choice. You won't have to set up utility accounts, pay deposits, or deal with the hassle of disconnecting services when you leave.
  4. Furnished Rentals: Many furnished apartments come with utilities included as part of the package. These are popular among travelers, students, and professionals on temporary assignments who want a turnkey living solution.
  5. Avoiding Utility Setup Hassles: Moving into a new place often involves the hassle of setting up utility accounts, which may require time and paperwork. In utilities-included apartments, these tasks are handled by the landlord or property management.
  6. Savings on Administrative Fees: Some utility providers charge administrative fees for account setup, transfers, or disconnecting services. By opting for utilities-included apartments, you can avoid these additional costs.
  7. Energy Efficiency: In some cases, landlords of utilities-included apartments invest in energy-efficient appliances and improvements, which can lead to lower overall utility costs. This is particularly appealing for eco-conscious renters.
  8. Shared Housing Arrangements: In shared housing situations, where multiple tenants are responsible for the rent and utilities, having utilities included can simplify the division of expenses and reduce conflicts over usage.
  9. All-Inclusive Resorts or Housing Communities: Vacationers and retirees often choose all-inclusive resorts or housing communities where utilities, as well as amenities like maintenance and security, are bundled into the overall cost.
  10. Extreme Weather Conditions: In regions with extreme weather conditions, such as harsh winters or scorching summers, utilities-included apartments can provide peace of mind, as tenants won't have to worry about skyrocketing heating or cooling bills.

It's important to note that while utilities-included apartments offer convenience, they may come at a slightly higher monthly rent compared to units where utilities are paid separately. Additionally, it's essential to review the terms of the lease carefully to understand what utilities are included and any usage limitations.

Ultimately, the decision to rent a utilities-included apartment depends on your specific circumstances, budget, and priorities. If the convenience and predictability of bundled utilities align with your needs and preferences, such an apartment can be an excellent choice for hassle-free living.

item.title: Things to consider in a rental place when traveling with kids
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Traveling with children can be an exciting adventure, but it also comes with unique challenges and considerations, especially when it comes to finding the right rental place. Parents want their kids to feel comfortable and safe while away from home. In this article, we'll explore essential factors to consider when choosing a rental place for a family vacation with children.

  1. Location Proximity to Attractions: Opt for a rental place that is conveniently located near family-friendly attractions and activities. This minimizes travel time and reduces the chances of children getting restless during long commutes. Research the local area to ensure there are parks, playgrounds, and entertainment options nearby.
  2. Safety and Childproofing: Safety should be a top priority. Check if the rental property is childproofed, with measures like cabinet locks, outlet covers, and stair gates. If not, consider bringing portable childproofing supplies. Also, assess the property for potential hazards such as sharp corners or exposed wiring.
  3. Space and Layout: Evaluate the layout and size of the rental place. Families with kids often benefit from multiple bedrooms or a separate living area where children can play. An open floor plan allows for better supervision. Check if there's outdoor space where kids can run and play safely.
  4. Amenities for Kids: Look for accommodations that offer kid-friendly amenities, such as cribs, high chairs, and baby bathtubs. Some rentals may also provide toys, books, or games for children. Having these amenities on-site can lighten the packing load for parents.
  5. Kitchen Facilities: Consider rentals with well-equipped kitchens. This allows you to prepare meals for picky eaters and accommodate dietary restrictions more easily. Having access to a refrigerator, microwave, and stove can be a game-changer for family dining.
  6. Laundry Facilities: Traveling with kids often means frequent wardrobe changes. A rental with laundry facilities or access to a washer and dryer can be a lifesaver. It reduces the need to pack excessive clothing and keeps everyone looking fresh.
  7. Reviews and Recommendations: Before booking, read reviews from other families who have stayed at the rental property. Their experiences can provide valuable insights into how child-friendly the place is and whether it meets your needs.
  8. Safety Features: Inspect the property for safety features like pool gates, balcony railings, and secure window locks. Ensure that any potential hazards are well addressed. If the property has a pool, inquire about pool safety measures.
  9. Local Healthcare Facilities: Research the availability of medical facilities, such as hospitals and pediatric clinics, in the area. Knowing where to go in case of a medical emergency provides peace of mind.
  10. Emergency Contact Information: Have emergency contact information readily available, including local emergency services, as well as contacts provided by the rental host or management.
  11. Child-Friendly Neighborhood: Consider the neighborhood's overall friendliness to families. Are there sidewalks for stroller walks, family-friendly restaurants, and a welcoming atmosphere for children?
  12. Budgetary Considerations: While ensuring a comfortable stay is crucial, it's also important to stay within budget. Look for rental options that strike a balance between your family's needs and your financial constraints.

Remember that every family is unique, and what works for one may not work for another. Tailor your rental selection to match your specific needs and preferences when traveling with kids. A well-chosen rental place can enhance the overall travel experience, making it enjoyable and memorable for both parents and children alike.

item.title: 10 Steps To Follow When Renting an Apartment
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Renting an apartment is a significant decision that requires careful consideration and planning. Whether you're a first-time renter or have experience in the rental market, following a structured process can help you find the right apartment that suits your needs and budget. Here are ten steps to follow when renting an apartment:

  1. Set a Budget: Determine how much you can comfortably afford to spend on rent each month. Your budget should include not only rent but also utilities, groceries, transportation, and other living expenses.
  2. Create a Wish List: Make a list of your apartment preferences and must-haves. Consider factors like location, size, number of bedrooms, amenities, and proximity to work, schools, or public transportation.
  3. Research Neighborhoods: Research different neighborhoods to find the one that best matches your lifestyle and needs. Consider safety, access to amenities, schools, and the overall vibe of the area.
  4. Start Your Search: Begin your apartment search using various resources, including online listings, rental websites, real estate apps, and local classifieds. You can also work with a real estate agent for more personalized assistance.
  5. Schedule Viewings: Once you've identified potential apartments, schedule viewings to inspect them in person. Pay attention to the condition of the unit, maintenance, and any potential issues.
  6. Check for Safety and Security: Evaluate the safety and security features of the building or complex. Look for secure entrances, well-lit common areas, and the presence of smoke detectors and fire extinguishers.
  7. Review the Lease Agreement: Carefully read the lease agreement, which is a legally binding contract between you and the landlord. Pay attention to terms, such as rent, security deposit, lease duration, and any rules or restrictions.
  8. Ask Questions: Don't hesitate to ask the landlord or property manager questions about the apartment, the neighborhood, and the lease terms. Clarify any doubts you may have before signing the lease.
  9. Inspect the Apartment: Before moving in, conduct a thorough inspection of the apartment. Document any existing damages or issues and bring them to the landlord's attention. This will help protect your security deposit when you move out.
  10. Secure Renters Insurance: Consider purchasing renters insurance to protect your personal belongings in case of theft, damage, or accidents. It's a relatively affordable way to provide peace of mind.

Renting an apartment is a significant commitment, so it's essential to take your time, do your research, and make an informed decision. By following these ten steps, you can navigate the rental process with confidence, ensuring that you find an apartment that meets your needs and aligns with your budget.

item.title: 11 Things You’ll Want In Your Next Vacation Place
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Planning your next vacation is an exciting endeavor. The anticipation of exploring new places, experiencing different cultures, and making lasting memories is enough to fuel your wanderlust. However, a crucial aspect of planning your dream vacation is choosing the right vacation place. Your choice of accommodation can significantly impact your overall travel experience. While everyone's preferences are unique, there are certain amenities and features that most travelers seek for a memorable trip. In this article, we'll explore 11 things you'll want in your next vacation place to make it an unforgettable getaway.

  1. Location, Location, Location: The importance of location cannot be overstated. A great vacation place should be situated close to the attractions, activities, and sights you plan to explore. Whether it's a beachfront property, a cabin in the woods, or a city apartment, proximity to your points of interest is key.
  2. Comfortable Accommodations: Comfortable and well-maintained accommodations are a must. Look for clean, spacious, and well-appointed rooms or living spaces that allow you to relax and unwind after a day of exploration.
  3. Safety and Security: Safety is a top priority for any traveler. Ensure that your vacation place provides a secure environment. Look for features such as secure entrances, well-lit common areas, and the presence of smoke detectors and fire extinguishers.
  4. A View to Remember: There's something truly special about waking up to a breathtaking view. Whether it's a scenic landscape, a vibrant cityscape, or an ocean vista, a captivating view can enhance your vacation experience.
  5. Outdoor Spaces: If you love spending time outdoors, seek accommodations that offer inviting outdoor spaces. Consider options like private balconies, terraces, gardens, or patios where you can soak in the natural beauty and fresh air.
  6. A Fully Equipped Kitchen: Having access to a well-equipped kitchen can be a game-changer, especially for travelers who enjoy cooking or want to prepare meals for dietary reasons. It also allows you to save money on dining out.
  7. High-Quality Amenities: Look for accommodations that offer a range of amenities to enhance your stay. This may include swimming pools, fitness centers, spa facilities, game rooms, or on-site dining options.
  8. Tech and Connectivity: In today's digital age, access to high-speed internet, smart TVs, and other tech amenities can make your stay more comfortable. It's also essential for staying connected with loved ones or for remote work if necessary.
  9. Accessibility Features: If you or someone in your travel party has mobility challenges, prioritize vacation places with accessibility features such as ramps, elevators, and ADA-compliant accommodations.
  10. Pet-Friendly Options: For travelers with furry companions, pet-friendly accommodations are a must. Look for vacation places that welcome pets, offer pet amenities, and are located near pet-friendly parks or trails.
  11. Local Insights and Hospitality: A warm welcome and local insights can elevate your vacation experience. Choose accommodations where the hosts or staff are knowledgeable about the area, offering recommendations for hidden gems, local cuisine, and cultural experiences.

In conclusion, your choice of vacation place plays a significant role in shaping your travel memories. While the preferences of travelers vary, the 11 factors mentioned above can serve as valuable guidelines when selecting your next vacation spot. Whether you're seeking relaxation, adventure, cultural exploration, or a mix of it all, finding a vacation place that meets your needs and desires will contribute to an unforgettable getaway. So, as you plan your next adventure, consider these 11 essential elements to create the vacation of your dreams.

item.title: Bright Artistic Apartment
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: Secure parking and additional storage in a downtown concrete building, this suite is in a concrete and steel, pet friendly, family building in a convenient downtown location. An ideal 1 bed, 1 bathroom home in a convenient village location. The kitchen, living and dining rooms open out to a level, private west facing 270sqft patio, great for entertaining. The strata is well run; the building was remediated in 1944 (new roof as well). Buses, church, shopping, all amenities close by. Just enough garden space so you can enjoy your own flower beds & veggies - and there's a covered patio for morning coffee. In great condition with many character features including private deck overlooking the back yard and park, Vinyl thermo windows and Epoxy coated Concrete floors (Radiant in-floor heat).

item.title: 5 Factors Affecting the Rental Cost of in States
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
The cost of renting a property can vary significantly from one state to another in the United States. There are several factors that contribute to these differences, making it crucial for tenants and landlords to understand what influences rental prices in their respective states. In this article, we will explore five key factors that affect rental costs in states.

  1. Location and Demand: The old adage "location, location, location" holds true when it comes to rental costs. Urban areas with high demand for housing tend to have higher rental prices. States with major cities like New York, California, and Massachusetts often have expensive rental markets due to the concentration of jobs, amenities, and cultural attractions. Conversely, rural states with lower population density generally have more affordable rentals.
  2. Local Economy: The economic health of a state can significantly impact rental costs. States with robust economies, driven by industries such as technology, finance, or entertainment, tend to have higher average incomes and, subsequently, higher rental prices. States with weaker economies and fewer employment opportunities often offer more affordable rental options.
  3. Housing Supply: The availability of rental properties plays a crucial role in determining rental costs. States with limited housing supply and high demand can experience steep rental price increases. Conversely, states with a surplus of available rental units are likelier to have stable or lower rental costs. Factors such as zoning regulations and construction rates influence housing supply.
  4. Property Type and Size: The type and size of the rental property also affect rental costs. More significant, more luxurious properties, such as single-family homes and upscale apartments, typically command higher rents. Smaller units, such as studios or one-bedroom apartments, are often more affordable. In addition, amenities like swimming pools, fitness centers, and pet-friendly policies can influence rental prices.
  5. Local Legislation and Regulations: State and local laws and regulations can have a substantial impact on rental costs. Rent control policies, eviction laws, and tenant rights can differ significantly from state to state. Some states have stricter rent control measures that limit rent increases, while others have more landlord-friendly regulations that allow for greater flexibility in pricing. Understanding the legal framework is essential for both tenants and landlords.

In conclusion, the rental cost in states is influenced by a complex interplay of factors, including location, local economy, housing supply, property type, and legislative regulations. Tenants and landlords should carefully consider these factors when navigating the rental market. It's important to conduct thorough research and assess individual circumstances to make informed decisions about renting or investing in rental properties.

Moreover, prospective tenants should budget accordingly and prioritize their housing needs based on their financial capacity and lifestyle preferences. Landlords should keep abreast of market trends and adhere to legal requirements while setting rental prices. By understanding the factors affecting rental costs in their respective states, both tenants and landlords can make sound choices in the dynamic and ever-changing rental market landscape.

item.title: Spacious One Bed Apartment
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Appointed with all of the amenities required for a relaxing stay, this suite is the ideal home away from home for your Orlando experience. Enjoy the convenience of all nearby theme parks and attractions, featuring resort amenities and stylish comfort perfect for small families, business travelers or couples. Guests will love our flat-screen television and Free Wi-Fi connectivity.

Truly a home away from home, unwind in the contemporary elegance of a studio suite featuring resort amenities and stylish comfort perfect for families, business travelers or couples. Tech-savvy guests will love our flat-screen televisions and Free Wi-Fi connectivity, while those who seek out creature comforts will delight in touches like gel-infused Sealy bed and spacious bathroom.

item.title: Exotic House on Hilltop
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Bright & Spacious, Top Floor/Corner Suite next to Sooke is sure to please. VILLAGE SPLENDOUR – this suite is in a concrete and steel, pet friendly, family building in a convenient downtown location. Immaculate south facing 3 superb bedroom, 3 bathroom corner suite in the community of central Quesnel. The final room on the main floor, facing the private west-facing garden, is the master bedroom. The home and gardens have been loving maintained by the current owner.

Don't miss this opportunity This home is only accepting cash and is a short sale with limited time! Buses, church, shopping, all amenities close by. Located in-town, adjacent to Point Grey, for an eco-friendly walk everywhere lifestyle. Situated on .31 acres and at the end of a very quiet cul-de-sac makes this an ideal location. As you walk into this 1962 home - you will see all the original character such as large commercial grade low E windows, Smart Wiring Options, brand new hardwood floors and carpet & exquisitely designed kitchen. This is a prestigious home. Note: large 6 ft basement for storage not included in measurements.

item.title: Spacious and Scenic Bungalow
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Enjoy the country living on this .53 acre mini estate and be only minutes from all amenities, ferries, the airport, and downtown Surrey. Bathed in sunlight from lots of windows, skylights & vaulted ceiling, this great NYC style Loft is sure to impress. South West corner, 3 bed, 3 bathroom with ocean, mountain and city views. Quality finishing, superior sound insulation & 2 spacious decks. Beautiful Gibraltar Model enhanced by 36'x 17' Screened Patio with beautiful travertine floor adding natural richness & a unique appearance to the patio.

Located in-town, adjacent to Gastown, for an eco-friendly walk everywhere lifestyle. Situated on 2 legal lots with a west facing rear yard backing onto a 3.7 acre natural park which offers panoramic views of the city and water plus amazing sunrises and sunsets. White Cabinetry/Granite counters, w/w carpet throughout the residence & Epoxy coated Concrete floors (Radiant in-floor heat) completes the picture. Great Investment !

item.title: Contemporary Villa
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Transformed through a tasteful and seem-less renovation, the floor plan has been beautifully adapted to modern life. Over 1,300 sq ft of living space which includes 3BRs and 3 baths. The wine cooler, sconzes, & TV's does not stay. The moment you enter the suite you will love the floor to ceiling windows that enhance the view. This beautiful home’s understated street presence is in perfect harmony with this tranquil neighbourhood.

The grounds, while compact, are designed to provide private garden areas, patio area, decks and off street parking. drive in garage with workshop area, en-suite bath and White Cabinetry/Granite counters round out this beautiful home. This is a large alternative for those who are tired of condo living and all the strata council rules and regulations and strata fees.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Orlando, Florida, United States of America

item.title: Stylish Studio Apartment
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: Whether you are a first time buyer, investor, or looking for a pied de terre have a look at this one! Substantially renovated with many large features, this custom home stands out as a unique and refreshing offering. This 1 bed suite offers outstanding views of the city, ocean and mountains. Walking/biking distance to downtown and shopping. Laminate Flooring is in ALL the Bedrooms - ABSOLUTELY the most beautiful FLOORS. Walking distance to everything. Just enough garden space so you can enjoy your own flower beds & veggies - and there's a covered patio for morning coffee. The downstairs has a great layout with Hand-chiseled Quartz Island, wood floors and commercial grade Wolf & Sub Zero appliances, plus even space left over for your piano! All Offers subject to Executors approval within reasonable business hours

item.title: Modern Apartment with Relaxing Ambience
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Appointed with all of the amenities required for a relaxing stay, this suite is the ideal home away from home for your Orlando experience. Enjoy the convenience of all nearby theme parks and attractions, featuring resort amenities and stylish comfort perfect for small families, business travelers or couples. Guests will love our flat-screen television and Free Wi-Fi connectivity.

Truly a home away from home, unwind in the contemporary elegance of a studio suite featuring resort amenities and stylish comfort perfect for families, business travelers or couples. Tech-savvy guests will love our flat-screen televisions and Free Wi-Fi connectivity, while those who seek out creature comforts will delight in touches like gel-infused Sealy bed and spacious bathroom.

item.title: Scenic Bungalow with Calming Ambience
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded:
Enjoy the country living on this multi acre mini estate and be only minutes from all amenities, ferries, the airport, and downtown Surrey. Bathed in sunlight from lots of windows, skylights & vaulted ceiling, this great NYC style Loft is sure to impress. South West corner, 3 bed, 3 bathroom with ocean, mountain and city views. Quality finishing, superior sound insulation & 2 spacious decks. Beautiful Gibraltar Model enhanced by 36'x 17' Screened Patio with beautiful travertine floor adding natural richness & a unique appearance to the patio.

Located in-town, adjacent to Gastown, for an eco-friendly walk everywhere lifestyle. Situated on 2 legal lots with a west facing rear yard backing onto a 3.7 acre natural park which offers panoramic views of the city and water plus amazing sunrises and sunsets. White Cabinetry/Granite counters, w/w carpet throughout the residence & Epoxy coated Concrete floors (Radiant in-floor heat) completes the picture. Great Investment !

item.title: Cosy, Contemporary House
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: Great Opportunity to get into the real estate market for less than the cost of Rent!! A traditional floorplan with 3 very affordable bedroom/3 bathroom and a spacious Rec Room w/wet bar above the garage. Bathed in sunlight from lots of windows, skylights & vaulted ceiling, this gorgeous suite is going to knock your socks off! Excellent location just a block from Happy Valley and minutes to Beacon Hill Park. It keeps coming… gorgeous floor to ceilings windows to allow plenty of natural lighting, a fantastic sunroom perched on the front of the house, in-suite laundry, separate dining area & hard surface counter-tops. Two side x side parking stalls, low monthly strata fees & Zoned for Live/Work; this is Urban Living at it's finest!

item.title: Luxury & Spacious Villa
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: So well built and with so many select amenities, this home delivers the very best of warm,period charm & superior upgrading. With 5 bathrooms, 5 beds up and a stunning rec room plumbed for a wet bar down plus a large single car garage this home offers excellent value and utility while also offering a family oriented tight knit community to call home. A wonderful home/retreat for anyone who enjoys a special sense of style. Don't miss this opportunity This home is only accepting cash and is a short sale with limited time! Excellent location just a block from Sooke and minutes to central Kamloops. Private backyard backs onto a quiet green belt, desirable patio space with an outdoor fire pit await the summer nights. Wide hallways, a superb sunroom perched on the front of the house, full basement with drive in garage and granite island. Call now and select your colors!

item.title: Comfortable Royal Apartment
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: A truly remarkable property nestled at the end of a cul-de-sac in Latoria Walk. Set on a private, southwest corner of a well managed complex in the heart of vibrant Point Grey, this gorgeous suite is going to knock your socks off! Modern open concept living w/2 unique bedrooms, 2 bathrooms (Master w/ensuite), Spacious Living Room, Dining room w/Bay window, & an Open Kitchen w/Stainless Steel appliances. Suite is plumbed and wired and ready to go. The roomy kitchen is a cook's delight & there's a separate dining room with extra tech nook - ideal computer/office space. It is ideally situated on a very private lot along a whisper quiet street. Easy care lot, extra parking pad, located on a major bus route and within walking distance to Fernwood. stainless appliances, 36" doorways, commercial grade Wolf & Sub Zero appliances, large commercial grade low E windows & wood floors completes the picture. BONUS: 2 years of parking included!

item.title: Comfortable Roomy Apartment
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: This fabulous Elk Lake is only one block from the Avenue with all the Trendy Shoppes,Fabulous Restaurants and only seconds to the Beach. Beautifully suited to entertaining, the floor plan has been beautifully adapted to modern life. Immaculate south facing 2 bed, 2 bathroom corner suite in the community of Sooke. A new marble finished fireplace creates warmth and focus to a space that is ideal for entertaining. Harbour views from main and upper floors. Just moments away you'll find all the amenities you'll need. The gentle slopped driveway leads up to your hilltop building site offering secure views without much site preparation. It keeps coming… built-in bookcases, wood windows, in-suite laundry, inlayed oak and fir floors & crafting room.

item.title: Comfortable Studio Apartment
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: Bright & Spacious, Top Floor/Corner Suite next to Brentwood Bay is sure to please. Transformed through a tasteful and seem-less renovation, A commanding presence greets with most pleasant curb appeal. This 1 bed suite offers outstanding views of the city, ocean and mountains. Don't miss this opportunity This home is only accepting cash and is a short sale with limited time! Walking/biking distance to downtown and shopping. Buses, church, shopping, all amenities close by. Easy care lot, parking for 6+ vehicles and the added bonus of a detached studio for your home based business. Suite is immaculate offering Hand-chiseled Quartz Island, fresh paint and wood floors.

I had an incredible stay at this rental property. The location was perfect, and the amenities exceeded my expectations. The apartment was clean, spacious, and beautifully decorated. item.title: Modern and Luxury Apartment
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: As soon as you walk into this Point Grey home you will be struck by the open space and clean lines - the perfect canvas on which to create your dream home. Situated across from unique Elk Lake, the floor plan has been beautifully adapted to modern life. Over 1,100 sq ft of living space which includes 2 beds and 2 bathrooms. Unique zoning for the building allows for legal short term rentals, pets allowed and a great onsite caretaker make this a worry free home. The extensive 2007 renovation has expanded floor space and functionality while respecting the integrity of the original design. It is ideally situated on a very private lot along a whisper quiet street. Beautiful log construction home on 1 acre. Smart Wiring Options, granite island, feature wall unit w/fireplace, field stone fireplace and drive in garage with workshop area lend a sophisticated feel to the home.

item.title: Modern Apartment with Creative Touch
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: As soon as you walk into this Point Grey home you will be struck by the open space and clean lines - the perfect canvas on which to create your dream home. Situated across from unique Elk Lake, the floor plan has been beautifully adapted to modern life. Over 1,100 sq ft of living space which includes 2 beds and 2 bathrooms. Unique zoning for the building allows for legal short term rentals, pets allowed and a great onsite caretaker make this a worry free home. The extensive 2007 renovation has expanded floor space and functionality while respecting the integrity of the original design. It is ideally situated on a very private lot along a whisper quiet street. Beautiful log construction home on 1 acre. Smart Wiring Options, granite island, feature wall unit w/fireplace, field stone fireplace and drive in garage with workshop area lend a sophisticated feel to the home.

item.title: A Grand Modern Apartment
item.dc:creator: fahid
item.content:encoded: Here's an unbeatable opportunity to get into the market at a sparkling clean price. Set on a private, southwest corner of a well managed complex in the heart of vibrant central Kamloops, this home has been designed to take advantage of its beach frontage with decks running the entire length of the house and out over the boathouse. Immaculate south facing 2 great bedroom, 2 bathroom corner suite in the community of Dollarton Harbour. Beautiful Gibraltar Model enhanced by 36'x 17' Screened Patio with beautiful travertine floor adding natural richness & a unique appearance to the patio. Perfect for an investor (short term rental rates are close to $2,000 per month) or for a first time home buyer (furniture negotiable!). Located in-town, adjacent to Happy Valley, for an eco-friendly walk everywhere lifestyle. This easy care property features a west facing patio off the kitchen ideal for summer BBQs and entertaining. It's tastefully updated – vaulted ceilings showcasing the log construction, hard surface counter-tops, commercial grade Wolf & Sub Zero appliances, hardwood & tile floors & security system sound and vac roughed in.
